channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Essential v non-essential jobs: How the survey was conducted
item.description:
June 16, 2020 6:38 PM

SINGAPORE - The survey company that conducted the poll commissioned by The Sunday Times has given more details of the methodology used.

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on June 16
item.description:
June 16, 2020 6:32 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Tuesday, June 16.Â

item.title: Call for Singaporeans to sing a national favourite in virtual choir performance during NDP
item.description:
June 16, 2020 6:08 PM

SINGAPORE - While this year's National Day Parade (NDP) theme song has yet to be announced, one familiar favourite will feature in the celebrations come August 9.

item.title: Clementi crash that killed NUS undergrad: Fellow passenger sues ex-cabby and other driver
item.description:
June 16, 2020 6:07 PM

SINGAPORE - One of the four passengers in a taxi involved in an accident, at a Clementi road junction two years ago that left one of them dead, has sued both the cabby and the driver of the oncoming car for negligence.

item.title: Phase 2 reopening: What are the safety guidelines for retail establishments from June 19?
item.description:
June 16, 2020 4:56 PM

Stores must ensure at least 1m spacing between customers, while activities and events in stores or mall atriums are not allowed.

item.title: Stranded and separated: Foreign families and workers hope to return to Singapore after more travel restrictions are lifted
item.description:
June 16, 2020 4:34 PM

SINGAPORE- When Ms Isha Chaudhari travelled out of Singapore in February, she would never have guessed that she would not see her husband again for more than four months.

item.title: DJ Tenashar, already facing drug-related charges, accused of offences including theft, criminal trespass
item.description:
June 16, 2020 3:36 PM

SINGAPORE - Celebrity DJ Tenashar, who faces drug-related charges, is now accused of other offences, including stealing a blue hospital gown at Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and using a stolen access pass to trespass into areas meant only for its staff.

item.title: No evidence that coronavirus can spread through salmon or other food, packaging: SFA
item.description:
June 16, 2020 3:14 PM

This followed news last week that traces of the coronavirus had reportedly been detected on cutting boards used for slicing salmon at a market in Beijing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Changi Airport T5 construction to be 'paused' for at least 2 years, says Khaw
item.description:
June 16, 2020 3:13 PM

Mr Khaw also said the Government is currently carrying out a study of how the aviation sector will change.

item.title: 151 new coronavirus cases in Singapore, lowest daily tally in more than 2 months
item.description:
June 16, 2020 3:12 PM

There are no Singaporeans or permanent residents among the cases.

item.title: Record number of 1,158 dengue infections last week as outbreak shows no signs of slowing
item.description:
June 16, 2020 2:30 PM

The total number of infections for the year as at 3pm on Monday was 11,166 - more than the total for most years.

item.title: Household electricity consumption increased by 22% during circuit breaker period: EMA, SP Group
item.description:
June 16, 2020 2:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Household electricity consumption jumped up almost a quarter last month compared with February this year, according to figures from the Energy Market Authority and national grid power operator SP Group.

item.title: Coronavirus: Firms have made over 100,000 phone calls to govt hotline about safe distancing measures
item.description:
June 16, 2020 1:05 PM

SINGAPORE - Businesses affected by safe distancing measures made 110,000 phone calls to government agency Enterprise Singapore's (ESG) information hotline between April 3 and June 15.

item.title: Two other men charged with Covid-19 offences in Robertson Quay incident
item.description:
June 16, 2020 12:56 PM

The British nationals were accused of meeting each other near Limoncello @ Robertson QuayÂ for the purpose of "chatting and drinks".Â

item.title: Grab cuts headcount by 5% as Covid-19 bites into business
item.description:
June 16, 2020 12:47 PM

SINGAPORE - Technology company Grab is cutting 363 jobs, or 5 per cent of its headcount, amid the growing economic fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Call for representatives of vulnerable and environmental groups to be included in Emerging Stronger task force
item.description:
June 16, 2020 12:46 PM

SINGAPORE - Minority groups, vulnerable communities and green sectors of the economy should see greater representation in the Emerging Stronger Taskforce, which will guide Singapore's economic recovery post-Covid-19.

item.title: Former pawnshop director charged in court with misappropriating over $5 million
item.description:
June 16, 2020 12:33 PM

SINGAPORE - A former pawnshop director accused of misappropriating more than $5 million from his then workplace faced 23 charges on Tuesday (June 16) for offences, including those related to criminal breach of trust and falsification of accounts.

item.title: Building design standards such as air-con rules could be changed post-Covid-19: BCA
item.description:
June 16, 2020 12:32 PM

SINGAPORE - Design standards for new buildings could change as the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) looks into whether rules on air-conditioning and mechanical ventilation need to be revised in the light of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 7 workplaces ordered to cease operations for lapses in safe management measures; 52 fines of $1,000 each issued to employers: MOM
item.description:
June 16, 2020 10:00 AM

Out of the seven, six had many employees at the workplace despite them being able to work from home.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 16
Coronavirus: Safe distancing measures will still be enforced
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

When Singapore's economy enters its second phase of reopening on Friday, the authorities will continue to ensure that safe distancing measures are observed, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Pet hotel operator faces charges of animal abuse
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The operator of pet hotel Platinium Dogs Club was charged yesterday with animal abuse and other offences involving 10 dogs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Better patient care with improved teleconsultation
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 200 doctors in the National Healthcare Group Polyclinics (NHGP) have been trained to check on patients via video link as the group enhanced its tele-consultation services to ensure patients continue to get the medical help they need during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: New hygiene campaign zeroes in on litterbugs
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Good hygiene habits, like not littering, can help safeguard public health beyond Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ban on live music, TV screenings at eateries among restrictions
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

When Singapore enters phase two of the post-circuit breaker measures on Friday, most outlets will reopen - but there will still be restrictions in place, such as a ban on TV screenings or live music at eateries. Some places, such as museums and libraries, will also remain shut for now.

item.title: From robot cleaners to remote physiotherapy sessions: Embracing tech in Covid-19 fight
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A look at five types of technology that have been adopted in Singapore in the fight against Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Temi reduces exposure of healthcare staff to patients
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Robots have reduced the amount of time that front-line healthcare workers spend with Covid-19 patients at SingHealth's community care facility at the Singapore Expo by six times.

item.title: NUS students punished for cheating on take-home exam
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A handful of National University of Singapore (NUS) students who cheated on a practical examination they were allowed to take home in March were punished last Tuesday, when results for the module were released.

item.title: Further easing of curbs not signal to let guard down: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Most activities in Singapore can resume on Friday, but the expansion should not be a signal for people to let their guard down, the multi-ministry task force tackling Covid-19 warned yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Robots ensure safe distancing in parks
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The recent circuit breaker measures saw many new visitors flocking to parks around the island - including two mechanical ones.

item.title: Ideas sought to tackle excessive use of disposables
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Practical solutions to tackle the excessive use of disposable items in Singapore are being sought through a new citizens' workgroup, which will meet between this September and next March.

item.title: Inbound travellers will have to pay for compulsory testing
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

All travellers entering Singapore from Thursday will have to take a Covid-19 test, and pay for it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Digital platform helped team of 5 field hundreds of queries
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Before the Covid-19 pandemic, the digital marketing team at the Singapore Global Network (SGN) handled fewer than a dozen questions a week, ranging from queries on its programmes and initiatives, to issues related to relocating to or out of Singapore.

item.title: Help for ITE students to market themselves
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Students from the Institute of Technical Education (ITE) are being taught how to brand and market themselves to potential employers.

item.title: Call for bosses to let staff keep working from home
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Employers are urged to let their workers continue to work from home when Singapore reopens the economy from Friday.

item.title: 12 staff in close contact with infected student cleared of Covid-19
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Twelve staff who had been in close contact with a confirmed student patient at St Anthony's Canossian Secondary School have been cleared of the coronavirus.

item.title: First female chief for S'pore Prison Service
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Prison Service (SPS) will see its first female commissioner with key leadership changes announced yesterday.

item.title: Months before phase 3 can begin: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

It could be months before Singapore reaches the third and final stage of its phased reopening, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: askST: What is being done to cut blood clot risks faced by Covid-19 patients?
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The Straits Times answers this question and others posed by readers, including what a decrease in the number of Covid-19 patients in care facilities means.

item.title: NEA puts up tender for 12-month in-depth study of funeral industry
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A comprehensive 12-month study of Singapore's funeral industry will be conducted to scrutinise standards and assess manpower demands.

item.title: Limit of five for groups makes political walkabouts possible
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Social gatherings of up to five people will be allowed during phase two of the economy's reopening, indicating that political parties will be able to conduct walkabouts in small groups in the run-up to the upcoming general election.

item.title: Apple-Google's contact tracing system not effective for Singapore: Vivian
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will not be using a contact tracing system jointly developed by tech giants Apple and Google.

item.title: Fine, jail for trio who camped on Ubin amid virus outbreak
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Three friends who breached circuit breaker measures on April 13, and paddled in kayaks to Pulau Ubin amid the Covid-19 pandemic, were each sentenced to four weeks' jail and a fine yesterday .

item.title: Phase two starts on Friday: Shops can reopen, dining in allowed
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will embark on phase two of reopening its economy on Friday, having managed to keep infections in check in the two weeks since the end of the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Cases with low viral load turn up 'due to test strategy'
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The increasing number of detected Covid-19 cases with low viral load is not due to the coronavirus mutating but, rather, a result of Singapore's unique testing strategy, said the Ministry of Health's (MOH) director of medical services Kenneth Mak yesterday.

item.title: Podcast hosts say sorry for misogynistic content
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The producers of podcast Okletsgo, who sparked an uproar with lewd and sexist content in their show, apologised yesterday afternoon, just hours after President Halimah Yacob criticised the show in a Facebook post.

item.title: Singapore's total employment figures see biggest quarterly drop
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The first three months of the year saw the steepest fall ever recorded in the number of people employed here, compared with the previous quarter, and there is worse to come.

item.title: Jail for drug trafficker earlier cleared of heroin capital offence
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A drug trafficker, who escaped the gallows earlier this year after the Court of Appeal accepted that there could have been a mix-up in the order he placed with his supplier, was jailed for eight years yesterday after being convicted of two amended charges.

item.title: Imported case: Man had been given waiver to enter on medical grounds
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A Bangladeshi man, who was Singapore's first imported case of Covid-19 since May 10, was granted a waiver to enter the country on medical grounds.

item.title: Probation for fifth man in unlawful Bionix photo case
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The fifth and final man in a case involving the unlawful dissemination of photographs showing a fatal Bionix accident was sentenced to six months' probation yesterday.

item.title: Many low-wage earners continue to work and get paid: Josephine Teo
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Many lower-paid workers continued to be employed during the circuit breaker period as they were engaged in essential services, said Manpower Minister Josephine Teo.

item.title: It felt like Mikaela was meant for us: Foster mum
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

When Mikaela's unmarried birth mother decided to give the toddler up for adoption, her foster parents - who had been looking after her since she was born - did not hesitate to adopt her.

item.title: Coronavirus: More long-term pass holders can return, but need prior approval
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

More long-term pass holders can return to Singapore during phase two of the country's reopening, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: SGH ranks 8th in survey of world's best hospitals
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore General Hospital (SGH) fell five spots in Newsweek magazine's annual ranking of the world's best hospitals, but managed to remain in the top 10.

item.title: Traineeships to help mid-career job seekers when recovery kicks in
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Opening more pathways for mid-career job seekers through the likes of traineeships can help them to get ready for the economic recovery, said Manpower Minister Josephine Teo.

item.title: More kids in foster care for better outcomes
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of children in foster care has increased in the past five years, after the Ministry of Social and Family Development's (MSF) efforts to place more children who have been abused, abandoned or neglected under the care of foster parents instead of in a children's home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ella helps keep Alexandra Hospital clean
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Meet the newest member of Alexandra Hospital's housekeeping staff: Ella the robot.

item.title: Majority feel public interaction should be in English: Study
item.description:
June 16, 2020 5:00 AM

There is wide acceptance that English should be the language used as far as possible in the public space, although there should still be space for other languages as diversity is a cornerstone of Singaporean identity, a study has found.
